It is time we stop classifying our Amerindian sisters and brothers automatically as vulnerable people. Many people living in the hinterland live in vulnerable situations. title: Aliann Pompey  Invitational shifted to July 22
description: The 2023 AP Invitational, the first-ever World Athletics Continental Tour event in Guyana, will now be held on July 22, organiser Aliann Pompey announced on Monday. After a four-year hiatus, the AP Invitational track and field championship was scheduled to return on Saturday, June 24, at the National Track and Field Centre at Edinburgh, WCD. title: Distribution of $40k per child ‘Because We Care’ cash grant starts on June 5
description: The Ministry of Education will soon start the distribution of this year’s ‘Because We Care’ cash grant, which has been increased to $40, per child in school. This was announced by Education Minister Priya Manickchand in a video-message post on her Facebook page. According to Manickchand, the distribution exercise will start on June 5 and […]

title: Attorney Ronald Burch-Smith is new Bar Association President
description: Attorney-at-Law Ronald Burch-Smith has been elected as the new President of The Bar Association of Guyana. The Association held its 44th Annual General Meeting today (May 31, 2023) via Zoom Online Platform. As part of the proceedings, the Bar Council for the 2023-2024 fiscal year was elected. title: EPA orders ExxonMobil Guyana to provide unlimited liability coverage
description: Even as it continues the fight in the Court of Appeal to overturn the High Court order, the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has issued an Enforcement Notice to compel ExxonMobil Guyana to provide unlimited liability parent company guarantee for its Stabroek Block holdings. title: 25 Guyanese to benefit from maritime scholarships through ACMF
description: Some 25 Guyanese will have the opportunity to pursue studies and training in the maritime sector through the provision of fully-funded scholarships being offered by the Florida-based American Caribbean Maritime Foundation (ACMF). ACMF announced today that it will be partnering with Guyana’s premier maritime training school – the Atlantic Alliance Maritime and Offshore Training Institute […]

title: Mother, daughter found dead in Providence house
description: The badly decomposed bodies of a woman and her young daughter were discovered today at their house in Providence, East Bank Demerara. Dead are 38-year-old Petrous Ross and her 13-year-old daughter, Gabrel Ross. title: Region 7 man arrested with shotgun, ammo
description: Police ranks in Region Seven (Cuyuni-Mazaruni) have arrested a 23-year-old male after he was found in possession of a 2-guage shotgun and matching ammunition.
